thread.title: Stroll along the coastline this Sunday | South Coast Herald
thread.title_full: Stroll along the coastline this Sunday | South Coast Herald

author: Pongrass Import
title: Stroll along the coastline this Sunday | South Coast Herald
text:
Shoreliners enjoyed glorious warm weather on leg four of the Win Walking In Nature Shoreline Challenge from Ramsgate to Southbroom recently.
Strollers were treated to the striking natural beauty of coastal flora and fauna, and with the sardines still around, the seabirds put on a delightful show.
For those carrying a bag to collect rubbish along the way, little litter was found on this particular 5.4km coastal stretch.
Zonel Louw (left) and Lize du Breez from Leisure Bay. Those taking part in this year’s challenge have now reached the halfway point.
Mzimkhulu Honorary Officer Maxine Willemse reported that 102 walkers and six fur-walkers took part.
The Shoreline Challenge is an annual event organised by the Mzimkhulu Honorary Officers.
The challenge is broken down into eight different walks of between five to seven kilometres held on a Sunday over the course of four months, from May to August.
It was a family outing (from left) Jacey Bekker, Denise van Wyk and her daughter, Alicia with Andre Bekker. The next walk of 6.95km is from Southbroom Beach to Mpenjati on Sunday, July 7.
For bookings, questions, or food orders, contact Maxine on 071 5176408.
Everyone is welcome.
